website_summaries.verdict: A very basic teleprompter intended for amateurs and novices who don't need a professional model and don't use this type of equipment very often.
pros: Easy to use and budget priced
If these are your top priorities, you don't have to waste time and money with a more costly option
cons: No fancy extras or features, and it's flimsy, but it earns praise for working as it should from budget-minded consumers

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This is by no means a high-quality teleprompter but it gets the job done and for the price you're paying you can't even build one on your own this cheap that will work this great. The reflective glass works perfectly, I would recommend to anyone on a budget.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn C.

customer_reviews.title: the unit is not sturdy and the card stock will come loose with just ...
customer_reviews.text: truly you get what you pay for -- card stock, a piece of cheap pressboard and a piece of glass. the unit is not sturdy and the card stock will come loose with just a gentle bump of a camera. all that said, it works! i paired it with the free parrot teleprompter app and have made several videos using the combo. I also found using the remote control with the parrot app made it much easier to control the speed of the scroll. the remote is overpriced at $20 - but it works.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas D. Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with the CuePro Prompter's simple design, easy setup, and functionality. It works very well. It came well packaged, which also serves to safely store the unit when not in use. The overall quality of material was very good. When I ordered it my expectations were not very high because of the low price. However, I was pleasantly surprised! You may need to add a black "drape" to go between the prompter and the camera - depending on your lighting setup.
customer_reviews.author: Dale DeNeal

customer_reviews.title: Good prompter!
customer_reviews.text: It's cheap, completely non-durable, but it works brilliantly. You lose about half a stop but it's more than worth it. Other mount options and a thicker baseboard for longer screws would be nice--lots of things would be nice!--but this is the cheapest way to get a good quality prompter setup.
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY
customer_reviews.text: They outright lie in the description. Cheap quality. Hood and back is made of thin cardboard...base is made of pressed wood. Glass isn't safety glass. This won't last even when handled with kid glove. For $44 they could have least include rail mounts or made the hood & back of durable plastic. Going back...DON'T BUY.
customer_reviews.author: IAWFilmWorks

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the price and efficient regardless of the ...
customer_reviews.text: It works as described. To be honest it even exceeded my expectations. My only issue with this product is that the black cover is not very durable BUT there is a 5 year warranty for parts failure from normal use. Bottom Line this prompter works and it works well -- just handle with some care. I would have given it 4 stars for the material but the replacement parts solves that issue. Good product for the price and efficient regardless of the material.
customer_reviews.author: Jayson

customer_reviews.title: Works great with either my phone or iPad
customer_reviews.text: Works great with either my phone or iPad. Because it's fairly small, the person being video-ed can't be too far from the camera, which means most shots are fairly close up. But for the price and ease of use, I can deal with it.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy G. Wisgerhof

customer_reviews.title: Awesome price Works Great
customer_reviews.text: This works fantastic. Very easy to read the words on an iPad or iPhone teleprompter app. I would suggest this to anyone.There is no place for your camera so you will have to have an additional stand for that.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Tuinder

customer_reviews.title: Works fine
customer_reviews.text: As long as you understand this is a "you get what you pay for" item, is a good value. It is a teleprompter made it out paper, cardboard, glad and wood. It works just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Planet Usa

customer_reviews.title: It's simple
customer_reviews.text: It's simple, it's cheap, it's flimsy, but it works great.
customer_reviews.author: TAG

customer_reviews.title: For such a tiny and super cheap prompter you get a real cool prompter that ...
customer_reviews.text: For such a tiny and super cheap prompter you get a real cool prompter that does the job if you do vlogs and Youtube videos but you are on a budget. Worth the price and does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Wahb Mabkhout

customer_reviews.title: Best deal for DIYers.
customer_reviews.text: 3 stars are for the price and 2 stars are for the product.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Pretty much glorified cardboard and wood with glass
customer_reviews.text: Pretty much glorified cardboard and wood with glass, but it gets the job done in a pinch and the price is great!
customer_reviews.author: Hallease

customer_reviews.title: A bit complex to set up. Nevertheless, it does what it's supposed to do.
customer_reviews.text: A bit complex to set up. Nevertheless, it does what it's supposed to do.
customer_reviews.author: Fabio A.

customer_reviews.title: Does the job if on a budget.
customer_reviews.text: It's okay, kinda fragile. Don't buy if you plan on moving it around a lot.
customer_reviews.author: RichInOrlando

customer_reviews.title: the right price and works great. Just s little concern how it will wear ...
customer_reviews.text: the right price and works great. Just s little concern how it will wear in time since it is just card board.
customer_reviews.author: Asian Global Press

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: $2 worth of parts and labor for this flimsy $45 dollar product. It's worth every bit of the $2.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: For the money it is great !!!! Nothing but Cardboard but it works!
customer_reviews.author: Kim Love Jones

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, but expensive
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice no-frills item that does the job. I think its over-priced based on the materials, but an inexpensive way to go compared to the alternatives.
customer_reviews.author: topshop

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy/parts missing
customer_reviews.text: First things first the box was unsealed when it arrived. Took everything out of the box, read the instruction sheet, looked for the clips, no clips, tried putting it together, the glass fits, albeit loosely, in its slot, the thin card stock used for the cover/lens opening would not hold together (hence the need for clips) and felt very flimsy, not sure I want to put a tablet/expensive phone on this thing as it has no way of securing said tablet/phone. I decided to reinvest in a better made model that will probably last a lot longer. As I did not get to use it I cannot say if it works as intended, others here say it does.
customer_reviews.author: Anon E. Mouse

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly good! Check out my video.
customer_reviews.text: It's not swanky. It's not svelte. Heck, it feels like a grade-school art project. But the darn thing works! And it works quite well! We're talking a tripod-mountable piece of chipboard with cardstock and some reflective glass. My video came out perfect shooting through the glass with no noticeable effect on exposure with my Canon T5i or Samsung S7 Edge. It's not huge, it's not glamourous, but if you're on a fixed income or need something for that one-off project, it works quite well. Easy to follow instructions. Be careful handling this - the glass is just sort of hanging out in the pre-cut crevice and will fall if it's off balance.
customer_reviews.author: The Truth

customer_reviews.title: I don't know how you can beat it for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is so well thought out and so easy to use; I don't know how you can beat it for the money. The image is crystal clear and we were able to read it at nearly 25 feet. We did not need to adjust lighting or the camera from our setup. It also folds down and is very easy to take on location. Just a note: I read other reviews on it and some comments are completely off base and misleading.. 1 There is no wood used in it, 2 the image is crystal clear and sharp, 3 We did not need to stop-down or adjust lighting.
customer_reviews.author: Film Maker

product_meta.title: CuePro Prompter Teleprompter
product_meta.description: Why wast time and money trying to build your own teleprompter when you can get a great one for the same cost and with beamsplitter glass. CuePro Prompter is the best teleprompter for the money, CuePro prompter works with all phones, tablets and pads up to 10 inches. We developed the CuePro Prompter to be a quality product the will last a long time if used as intended and not abused. We tested it by setting it up and disassembling it 100 times to make sure it would last. We gave it a 5 YEAR warranty It is made in the USA, and it's used by many professional studios including our own. Important: In spite of what some reviews express there is NO CARDBOARD OR WOOD in this product. Product Description: Glass: Beam Splitter, Base Material: Plastic, Mount: Steel 1/4-20 insert, Hood / Lens Matt Material: Recycled composite consisting of Cotton, Polyester, Wool and binders Clips / Pads Clips: Coated steel Pads: Adhesive rubber
feature_bullets: Best teleprompter for the money, Designed by a videographer / filmmaker, 5 year warranty, Made in USA.
Sharp clear image, can be used with phones and pads up to 10"
Fast easy setup, compact when stored, easy to travel with
Tested 100 times on location and studio and still functioning perfect

Important: In spite of what some reviews express other than the packaging; there is NO CARDBOARD, PAPER, WOOD OR WOOD FIBER used in this product. Materials: Beam Splitter Glass, Plastic, Fiber Board Composite, Steel. Please feel free ask us any question
